meta.notes: Initial skeleton created from Alpha service manual and training documentation. Conservative, low-confidence entries only.

symptoms.name: Not dispensing coffee
symptoms.description: Machine does not dispense coffee when selected

symptoms.name: Poor coffee quality
symptoms.description: Bad taste, no crema, incorrect volume or flow

symptoms.name: Milk not dispensing or poor milk quality
symptoms.description: Milk not flowing, dripping, poor foam, cold milk

symptoms.name: Water flow or pressure issue
symptoms.description: Low flow, dripping, or pressure-related issues

symptoms.name: Steam temperature or pressure issue
symptoms.description: Steam too weak, too strong, or unstable

alpha_unknown_investigation.text: Begin investigation using Alpha service and training procedures.

result.title: Investigation required (manual-guided)
result.likelyCause: Multiple possible causes depending on calibration, supply conditions, cleaning state, or component condition.
fieldFix: Verify water supply pressure is within 2.5–5 bar.
Confirm correct water filtration and bypass setting.
Check pump pressure is set to approximately 8.5–9 bar.
Run flowmeter tests (Y1 infusion and Y3 bypass) via service menu.
Check grinder blade wear and grind time.
Calibrate piston via service menu if piston errors are present.
Verify steam boiler pressure is set to approximately 1.1–1.2 bar.
Confirm milk system and cleaning cycles have been performed correctly.
official: Refer to Alpha Service Manual V3.0.
warnings: Steam boiler contains pressurised hot water and steam.
Depressurise and isolate machine before opening hydraulic components.
Incorrect calibration can mimic component failure.
